docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 21 -- Middle Witwatersrand gold-mining shares claimed most attention in the stock markets here today. Dealers in London and at the Cape reported increased public speculation in the shares and the turnover again was large.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 21 -- Middle Witwatersrand gold-mining shares claimed most attention in the stock markets here today. Dealers in London and at the Cape reported increased public speculation in the shares and the turnover again was large.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Middle Watwatersrand Issues Still Most Active -- Gilt-Edge Stocks Again Decline

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Nov. 22 -- Three hundred to 400 "leaders" of the insurgent forces in the recent civil war are at present being "tried," President Higinio Morinigo told this correspondent today in an interview. The men jailed include "ten to...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Nov. 22 -- Three hundred to 400 "leaders" of the insurgent forces in the recent civil war are at present being "tried," President Higinio Morinigo told this correspondent today in an interview. The men jailed include "ten to fifteen" Communits, he added.
docs.abstract: Morinigo repts 300 to 400, including 10 or 15 Communist leaders, being tried as rebels; says 5,000 who fled country have returned; US Sgt A E Allen experience recounted

headline.main: 300 PARAGUAYANS ON TRIAL AS REBELS; Morinigo Lists 10 to 15 Reds as Leaders -- He Says 5,000 Who Fled Have Returned

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 22 -- Replying to a rising tide of legal objections to the proposed partition of Palestine, Hershel V. Johnson, the United States representative, today criticized Great Britain for having confronted the United Nations General...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 22 -- Replying to a rising tide of legal objections to the proposed partition of Palestine, Hershel V. Johnson, the United States representative, today criticized Great Britain for having confronted the United Nations General Assembly with an almost insuperable task.

headline.main: JOHNSON ASSAILS BRITAIN FOR STAND IN U.N. ON PALESTINE; U.S. Delegate Says Mandatory Poses Almost Insuperable Job, Gives 'Desultory' Help LEGAL OBJECTIONS MOUNT New Zealand, Denmark Intend to Abstain -- Needed Margin for Partition Narrows BRITAIN ASSAILED IN PALESTINE CASE

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW TOKK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS N.Y., Nov. 23 -- The United Nations Ad Hoc Committee on the Palestine Question is within sight of its goal -- a vote on the two plans before it for the government of the Holy Land after the British Government ends its mandate.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS N.Y., Nov. 23 -- The United Nations Ad Hoc Committee on the Palestine Question is within sight of its goal -- a vote on the two plans before it for the government of the Holy Land after the British Government ends its mandate.
docs.abstract: Gen Assembly to vote on plans

headline.main: ABSTENTIONS VITAL IN PALESTINE VOTE; Number of Nations Balloting Called Key to the Outcome of Issue of Partition

byline.original: By MARSHALL E. NEWTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 24 -- An Arab proposal to create a single Palestinian state was rejected tonight by the Committee on Palestine of the United Nations General Assembly. The vote was 29 against, 12 for, 14 abstentions and two countries absent.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 24 -- An Arab proposal to create a single Palestinian state was rejected tonight by the Committee on Palestine of the United Nations General Assembly. The vote was 29 against, 12 for, 14 abstentions and two countries absent.
docs.abstract: participates in UN Palestine com session

headline.main: UNITARY PALESTINE FAILS IN COMMITTEE; U.N. VOTE 29 TO 12; Arabs Encouraged by close Polls on Other Moves -- Pleas to World Court Rejected

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Nov. 24 -- The heads of delegations at the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment decided today on the election of Max Suetens of Belgium as first vice president, C.H. Bhabha of India as second vice president and five other vice...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Nov. 24 -- The heads of delegations at the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment decided today on the election of Max Suetens of Belgium as first vice president, C.H. Bhabha of India as second vice president and five other vice presidents.
docs.abstract: delegation heads decide on 7 vps and com chmn; maneuvering for posts discussed

headline.main: TRADE CONFEREES JOCKEY FOR POSTS; Delegation Chiefs in Havana Agree on Belgian for First Vice President at ITO Talks

byline.original: By RUSSELL PORTERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 25 -- Doubts about the outcome of the Four-Power Conference had a restraining influence on the stock markets here today.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 25 -- The Palestine Committee of the United Nations General Assembly approved today a plan to partition Palestine and set up two independent states, one Arab and the other Jewish, after the termination of the British mandate...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 25 -- The Palestine Committee of the United Nations General Assembly approved today a plan to partition Palestine and set up two independent states, one Arab and the other Jewish, after the termination of the British mandate over the Holy Land.

headline.main: PALESTINE DIVISION WINS IN COMMITTEE 25 TO 13, 17 ABSTAIN; Same Vote in U.N. Assembly Today Would Be, One Short of the Two-thirds Required PARTITION VICTORY SEEN Delegate Predicts Resolution Will Win by Two -- Security Council Gets Authority PALESTINE DIVISION WINS IN COMMITTEE REVISED BORDERS VOTED BY COMMITTEE

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Representatives of ten nations supported the partition of Palestine and those of eight opposed it in the course of an all-day debate yesterday in the United Nations General Assembly at Flushing Meadow, Queens.

docs.snippet: General Assembly Met at 11 A.M. at Flushing Meadow, Queens, and debated partition report of Ad Hoc Committee on Palestine Questions. Heard representatives of Sweden, Philippines, Yemen, Canada, Greece, Brazil, United Kingdom, United States, Iran and...
docs.lead_paragraph: General Assembly Met at 11 A.M. at Flushing Meadow, Queens, and debated partition report of Ad Hoc Committee on Palestine Questions. Heard representatives of Sweden, Philippines, Yemen, Canada, Greece, Brazil, United Kingdom, United States, Iran and Egypt.
